column5: No matter what was called for, we were not going to miss the opener here on Simcoe. Bay was calm at 5am,wind was nada. Not sure what the weatherman was talking about.  We hit a local spot first with nothing to show. The weather was still favorable, so we decided to bee line it to our spot of years past. Turned out to be a good move. Not 5 minutes in and fish was on. A bigg,n that would peel line and bull dog. Saddley, the hook was pulled. Back down and the same thing. Big fish on. After about 10 minutes,get the fish close enough to see and it,s a pig of a laker. It rolled and yup, popped the hook. This fish was easy the biggest we have ever had at the boat. Some choice words were shared.  Noticed the treble was a bit on the small side, so swapped it out to a larger one. Seemed to be the ticket. Only 3 others got off,but 5 were landed.  A couple of wet old byes by 11:30 and called it as the called weather finaly showed up. Great to get the battle back on.                  Thanks bud for another great day out on the Lady.
awesome!
Nicely done!  S.
Nice Job keep a couple for the smoker??
Not bad for a couple of old guys.. this one stayed dry today!!
where's the watermelon? nice going
Good job! The wind report for tomorrow doesn't look good for my plans, but I'm not sure I can wait until Friday.
it was wet but still a good simcoe opener only 1 fish was harmed in the making of this trip...the rest swim to be caught another day  the second fish  Brian had on today was a monster
Nice fish guys!!!  Looks like a great time!

it was wet but still a good simcoe opener only 1 fish was harmed in the making of this trip...the rest swim to be caught another day  the second fish  Brian had on today was a monster  I hope you got a pic atleast, of that second one before the hook got pulled.  Man, still kicking myself for horseing it. Should know better.
I am thinking, single siwash.............  Nice lakers guys!Doug
Well done guys!!!!!!
where's the watermelon? nice going    Rick, remember that day you came up? Well same thing, and same fish Im sure. Maybe a few pounds added Im sure.LOL
I've seen lakers destroy even upgraded hooks, good job boys!   I am going to get out one day this week after work for a bit of a troll.
You guys did great. That spoon sure took a beating. Good move to move up on the hook size. Sometimes it's just enough to drive it deeper into the fish.
Congrats on some nice fish and great pics
Nice fish!

Thanks all. Got a long weekend coming to do it all again.  Was hopeing to get out for some toon whitefish this morning.   where's the watermelon? nice going   Oh you mean that other go too spoon? It will come out very soon. There is still some melon left on it.
Wow. Great job bud. Some real nice catches.
Great stuff B and Terry, want to get out there myself soon
Oh the bugs will be waiting for you J.
Great job gentlemen!  Awesome opener for you both.
Nice job Rain or bugs or snow or....... All good times !
Amazing average size out there, wow.  Great fish, guys!
